newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares rise in mixed trade.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares rise in mixed trade.

text.p: Turkish stocks saw moderate gains on Friday morning with selective activity in a mixed trade, brokers said.
The IMKB National-100 rose 1.08 percent or 21 points to 1,974. Morning trade volume shrank to 11.582 trillion lira ($71.4 million) from Thursday's 17.31 trillion ($108.6 million).
"Brokers were cautious ahead of July's monthly inflation figure to be announced on Monday," said Erden Gokay from Taksim Securities.
Turkish bankers and economists have predicted that the July inflation figure will be higher than that for the same 1996 month due to mid-month petroleum product price rises.
A Reuters poll showed that July consumer prices are expected to be around 4.8-5.5 percent and wholesale prices 5.5-6.0 percent.
State-owned flat steel producer Eregli's shares, the leading share in the past two days, were quiet, brokers said. The share ended the morning session at 26,000 lira down from Thursday's 26,750.
Mine Mumcu from Eczacibasi Securities believes foreign investors buy blue chips and Eregli shares.
"However they are not very aggressive," she said.
Mumcu said the market index broke its resistance at 1,950.
"In the afternoon session, we may see some profit taking sales but I do not expect much," she added.
The index fluctuated in a band of 1,943-1,980 in the morning session.
* Of 248 shares traded, gainers outdid losers sharply by 135 to 39 and 74 were stable.
The IMKB Industrial inched up 0.47 percent to 1,912, the IMKB Services eased 0.41 percent to 1,933 and the IMKB Financial gained 2.57 percent to 2,118.
The highest gain was seen in the banking sector index which showed a 3.18 percent rise.

The highest trade volume was seen in largely state owned flat steel producer Eregli, down 750 lira to 26,000, followed by electronics utility Vestel up 1,100 lira to 11,500 and media conglomerate Dogan Holding up 200 to 4,350.
The three made up 20.4 percent of total volume.
